[{'created': '2013-03-06 21:09:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Compress response's content according to client's accepted encoding

Currently Glance ignores the Accept-Encoding header and returns
responses as they are regardless the client accepts gzip or other type
of compression.

This patch adds this capability to glance supporting just gzip for now.

Important note:
    - The patch uses a lazy compression for Content-Type
      application/octet-stream but in order to do that, the
      content-length has to be unset which means that when an image is
      downloaded the content-length will be unknown to the client.

Fixes bug: 1150380

commit_message:
Compress response's content according to client's accepted encoding

Currently Glance ignores the Accept-Encoding header and returns
responses as they are regardless the client accepts gzip or other type
of compression.

This patch adds this capability to glance (by using a middleware)
supporting just gzip for now.

Important note:
    - The patch uses a lazy compression for Content-Type
      application/octet-stream but in order to do that, the
      content-length has to be unset which means that when an image is
      downloaded the content-length will be unknown to the client.

Fixes bug: 1150380

Change-Id: I42af1fbd9e601e0340da31604a2f698d98ba3198

commit_message:
Add crossdomain.xml middleware

Allows client-side technologies such as Flash, Java and Silverlight running
on web pages served elsewhere to interact with the Swift API.

Bug #1159960

Change-Id: I7d0533a0aaf189ac452abbd983469acb064fdca4

commit_message:
Add instance_type extra_specs to system_metadata

With extra_specs in system_metadata, cases where db calls are needed
to fetch the extra_specs can be replaced with calls to
instance_types.extract_instance_type to get it from locally from the
instance.

Resolves bug 1134650.

Change-Id: I5b8edef84dc2b652778e364fbf886adcca0506f0

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Ie20344e96f3d12e93695579adff0a0d9b4c1c516

commit_message:
Remove internal store references from migration 015

Migration 015 was accessing a object internal to the swift store driver
and changing its behavior in order to do the migration.  This worked but
it made the assumption that the driver logic would not change without
also changing the migration code.  These two should not be dependent
upon each other.  This patch removes all dependencies on swift from the
migration code.

Fixes bug: 1025746
Change-Id: Ic9559ae809b8784d0992cb5275d3911a725110c8

Fallback to conductor if types are not stashed.

If the instance types are not stashed, fallback to
the conductor API to retrieve them.

bug 1164110

commit_message:
set bdm['volume_id'] to None rather than delete it

bdm is a sqlalchemy model object, it doesn't make sense to delete
an attribute, so just set it to None

Fix bug 1166160

Change-Id: I41017af602f0c8369d442b4a6936e1a829d2f9a9

commit_message:
Treating auto-assigned floating IPs like normal floating IPs

User could unassigned an auto-assigned floating IPs of a server.
- When an auto-assigned floating IP is unassigned from a server, the
floating IP is automaticaly deallocated on the project.
- When a server is destroyed, the auto-assigned floating IP is
  deallocated on the project.
- Now, the auto-assigned floating IPs affect quota.

Change-Id: I9e80c2ef677192dfe9e415cbf4fd2192618207ba
Fixes: bug #1150772

commit_message:
Send a instance create error notification

Send a 'create.error' notification if instance creation (run_instance)
fails.

This will make it easier for external notification consuming systems to
learn when instance build attempts fail within the nova-compute layer.

blueprint create-error-notification

Change-Id: I62d7c9c80c51241bf124509af7cdd8484d9ea2d3

into the following categories:

* success
* rescheduled - an error occurred, but the build will be returned to
scheduled for another attempt.
* aborted - build was aborted for a non-error.  (e.x. instace was
deleted during spawn)
* fatal - general case of uncaught exceptions resulting in the instance

commit_message:
Refactor _run_instance() to unify control flow

_run_instance() had multiple points where various classes of errors
were handled.  This patch classifies the possible error/exit conditions
into the following categories:

* success
* rescheduled - an error occurred, but the build will be returned to
scheduled for another attempt.
* aborted - build was aborted for a non-error.  (e.x. instace was
deleted during spawn)
* fatal - general case of uncaught exceptions resulting in the instance
going to error.

blueprint create-error-notification

Change-Id: I3f01753bde8af0750ba9067c8a98ded45d5a0eb7

commit_message:
copy X-Delete-At unless X-Fresh-Metadata: true is supplied on an object copy

Current codes will copy metadata headers when x-fresh-metadata:false, we
still need copy "x-delete-at" header and ensure expiring work at the same
time.

Change-Id: Ie31326b5f7b565e51e5aa249279bc1786f7bc847
Fixes: bug #1067528

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-17 12:00:07.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pip-requires'], 'message': "Update requests version

A python-requests upgrade process was started before grizzly and was
planned to get into havana. Current projects don't depend on
requests<=1.1 anymore and this upgrade is needed in python-glanceclient.

Clients using python-requests are listed bellow:

Cinder:
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L3
Nova:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4
Keystone:
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4

Change-Id: I56c42eb7fdc5ac19736f125d3bffc52c9e26efee
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update requests version

A python-requests upgrade process was started before grizzly and was
planned to get into havana. Current projects don't depend on
requests<=1.1 anymore and this upgrade is needed in python-glanceclient.

Clients using python-requests are listed bellow:

Cinder:
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L3
Nova:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4
Keystone:
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4

Change-Id: I56c42eb7fdc5ac19736f125d3bffc52c9e26efee

as the URI can contain credentials

commit_message:
Bugfix: Deleting a claimed msg is idempotent.

If the message does not exist or expired, it's not an error to
delete nothing.  The original implementation works when claim
is not supplied, but throws exception when claim involves.

Change-Id: Ic689058c2f67be6c9eebd3ba342bb73369e4f41b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-26 14:00:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Bug # 1172337 - Removed unnecessary redirection from includes.

In several instances the openstack-install guide includes content from

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-26 14:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/common/dashboard-verify.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/vnc-console.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/common/dashboard-configure.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/about-dashboard.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/common/samples/local_settings.py', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/ch_installdashboard.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/common/figures/dashboard-overview.png', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-install/ap_configuration_files.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/common/dashboard-system-reqs.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/common/dashboard-install.xml'], 'message': 'Bug # 1172337 - Removed unnecessary redirection from includes.

In several instances the openstack-install guide includes content from

commit_message:
Bug # 1172337 - Removed unnecessary redirection from includes.

In several instances the openstack-install guide includes content from
itself by first traversing up a directory (href="../openstack-install/...").

This causes some (minor) consternation when building with alternate
toolchains, I have moved content included in this manner (and associated
figures/samples) to the common content directory.

Change-Id: Ic73e76155b993bc6bcb21be12957688e74b95247

commit_message:
cinder volume service keeps retrying even code exception

Make sure that ProcessLauncher does not try to restart the failed
service. And make sure the ProcessLauncher exits, when the number
of the failed services equal the number of total services.

Fixes: bug 1167841
Change-Id: I818c754534c18a62d292e21f0c98086571fe0565

commit_message:
Cinder wasn't filtering the backups returned to backup list API

This has the side effect of return all backups in the system (regardless of
who created them) to the user. You should only see the backups created in your
current active project.

Fixes bug: 1169461

Change-Id: I121e8ed215b28f1b21e24b2104f8294039e09b48

commit_message:
Remove _path_exists method.

This method is buggy because it works only on host machine with english language, and
apparently this method is also useless because we don't need to check if a path exist if
we can use command option -p for "mkdir" command and option -f for "rm" command.

bug: LP#1172777
Change-Id: I418b32772ca97b42e1a43275a7abec9f96688607

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-15 15:27:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when RPC backend is not needed

A RPC backend is needed only when at least one of the following services is
enabled: nova quantum heat glance cinder ceilometer. When none of these
services is activated, no error message should appear if a RPC backend is not
set via ENABLED_SERVICES.

Change-Id: I4e47e0c675c74775b4ea53a00848ac1d777f0125
Fixes: bug #1167338
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-24 08:32:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when RPC backend is not needed

When no service needing a RPC backend is activated, no error message should
appear if a RPC backend is not installed. A simple check is done on the
services installation files to see which services need to initialize a RPC
backend at some point; if none of these services are in ENABLED_SERVICES
then the error message is skipped.

commit_message:
Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when no backend is needed

When no service needing a RPC backend is activated, no error message
should appear if a RPC backend is not installed. A simple check is
done on the services installation files to see which services need to
initialize a RPC backend at some point; if none of these services
are in ENABLED_SERVICES then the error message is skipped.

Change-Id: I4e47e0c675c74775b4ea53a00848ac1d777f0125
Fixes: bug #1167338

commit_message:
Add support to clear DB

Fixes bug 1171740

The method cleanup() can be called when a test is complete,
for example in the tearDown method.

commit_message:
Adds utilization based scheduling

Extends state reporting to include up-to-date resource utilization of
hosts. Adds claims support and stats profiling to resource tracker.
Adds scheduler filters and weighers that exploit the added stats.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint utilization-based-scheduling
Change-Id: Ic47c26e79d36392d16421168bab496d9381989d9

commit_message:
Clear volumes stuck in 'downloading'

If the CinderVolume service is restarted while an image-copy is
happening, the volume gets left in a 'downloading' state and
cannot be used or deleted. This fix adds code to init_host to
look for volumes (on this host) in such a state, and move them
to an error state. It also calls clear_download in the driver
in case the driver needs to perform an action, such as
detaching the volume.

Fixes Bug #1172645

Change-Id: Ia5dab9ebf997f573c0b4e57d983f5996af81ede5

commit_message:
Update to latest copy of OSLO incubator

Specifically I wanted the change be84db3ab24ef94b6ec457bb299d48c51575e8a6
to oslo-incubator to fix my logging issue.

I ignored the changes in common/policy.py as this change breaks
the cinder unit tests.

Fixes bug: 1170038

Change-Id: Id72417d58c8f4bf139aa082131154153a175689d

commit_message:
Fixes 3PAR FC driver synchronization

While running  stress tests we found missing synchronized methods.
This patch added synchronized anotations around the necessary
methods.

Fixes bug 1172503

Change-Id: I8e475fe38d96ca663fbaac40c5a50420d791f5d5

expired change https://review.openstack.org/25299 with unit
tests added and some problems fixed.

and backup_restore to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the
volume backup extension is available via both apis.

backup extension is available via both APIs.

and backup-show to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the volume

commit_message:
Add support for volume backups

Implements support for the volume backup api added to cinder in
https://review.openstack.org/19468. This is a resubmit of the
expired change https://review.openstack.org/25299 with the
following changes:

* Added unit tests for backups (v1 and v2)
* Changed references in backup code to display_name and
  display_description to name and description respectively
* Removed links from backup-show output
* Added object_count to _translate_backup_keys
* Removed unneccesary items from _translate_backup_keys
* Fixed backups docstrings including removing references to swift.

Adds backup-create, backup-delete, backup-list, backup-restore
and backup-show to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the volume
backup extension is available via both APIs.

Change-Id: I197384f1c2fd2af641d207a5f4dba0dfbc5c681a

commit_message:
Wrong proxy port for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27524/

Change-Id: I3d7df3bfc7e0520024bbbe409aa9ae5735982f9e

commit_message:

Now several servers are created in test_multiple_create.py but
the servers are not deleted when the test finishes.

appending them to cls.servers.

currently being used by other projects throughout OpenStack.

commit_message:
Add a RHEL6 post-prereq phase

Add some post-prereq actions for RHEL6:

 * pre-install dbus to avoid the service not having ever been started
 * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
 * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
   of local versions
 * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

Change-Id: I089c07da32d211d25b14ce62cb61d2e3e8e6bb9f

commit_message:
Some tiny linter-appeasing tweaks.

- regexes should be raw strings to avoid accidental escaping
- Eliminate use of deprecated string module.
- Linewrapping, etc.
- Swapped out deprecated filter() calls for simple list comprehensions.
- Functions shouldn't redefine their own names.
- Marked a few things as @staticmethod where appropriate.

Change-Id: I9dae0ec65d568d691ae86d26f33aba82ad6a7abc

subject: Keep snapshot in saving status after instance deleted
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-15 09:29:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Keep snapshot in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make nove to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

commit_message:
Keep snapshot in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make nove to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: I663cfb32e30daf86fc52694bca0d8fcd15afe5ba

subject: Don't try to split a list of memcache servers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-11 03:41:31.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Auth_token.py has moved from keystone to python-keystoneclient in
grizzly, so this patch is picked from python-keytoneclient.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Auth_token.py has moved from keystone to python-keystoneclient in
grizzly, so this patch is picked from python-keytoneclient.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594

commit_message:
Simplify delete_health_monitor() using cascades

Currently delete_health_monitor() emulates behaviour of
cascade deletion: when a HealthMonitor instance is deleted,
all corresponding PoolMonitorAssociations are queried and
deleted one by one. This can be done automatically by means
of SQLAlchemy if we set proper cascade flags on the relationship
between HealthMonitor and PoolMonitorAssociations models.

Fixes bug 1169107.

Change-Id: I674c381192719a56433f67be53a32203c36ebe2b

commit_message:

subject: Mark resources as failed when creation aborted
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 11:38:43.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Mark resources as failed when creation aborted

Previously resources would be left in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state in the
event of a timeout or the thread being cancelled (due to a delete being
requested while the stack was still being created). We should instead put
these resources into the CREATE_FAILED state when this occurs, thus
creating an event with the reason.

Change-Id: I05956aa9ef26941b79cef9dbf0cb6a347047d199
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Mark resources as failed when creation aborted

Previously resources would be left in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state in the
event of a timeout or the thread being cancelled (due to a delete being
requested while the stack was still being created). We should instead put
these resources into the CREATE_FAILED state when this occurs, thus
creating an event with the reason.

Change-Id: I05956aa9ef26941b79cef9dbf0cb6a347047d199

commit_message:
Create veth peer in namespace.

 * Update veth pair creation to set the namespace of the peer
   device on creation rather than subsequently adding it to the
   namespace.
 * This change supports kernels with limited namespace support
   (e.g. RHEL 6.5) so long as ovs_use_veth is set to True.
 * Addresses bug 1171727

Change-Id: I1885acc9934e7627bb9872703df7f5edf2980722

commit_message:
Allow additional attribute mappings in ldap

This is needed as a work around for objectclasses that require additional
attributes other than just what is supplied in user_id_attribute and
user_name_attribute.

Change-Id: Ie6cdd0534b8389f62f98fdca7d19bc0feb9c131f
Fixes: bug #1158077

commit_message:
Allow listing fixed_ips for a given compute host.

nova.db.fixed_ip_get_all_by_instance_host was removed in commit
bb867ce3948ddc23cf928ca3dda100a1a977896a, but was still used in
nova-manage. This patch works around the removal of the foreign
key that led to this method being removed.

Resolves bug 1163660.

Change-Id: Ieccd37c752e245558827615c098604d11ad3d945

commit_message:
Modify RPM lists for RHEL6

Modifications to the RPM list to make devstack work on RHEL6.  Makes
various packages only install on Fedora distros; generally letting pip
install the missing dependencies on RHEL.

Additionally the Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora.
Also a small re-write of the config file is required to avoid
authenication issues.

Change-Id: If497099d27aa9cd80e1c1cee1aff2ed6b076d309

commit_message:
Move auth_token config to .conf, key cache directories

auth_token configuration can now be read from the conf files
rather than the paste.ini files.

A key cache directory has been created for each of the 3 API services
under /var/cache/heat

This is the devstack change relating to
Heat Blueprint: keystone-middleware

This is related to this committed change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26351/

Devstack users will find Heat to be broken until this corresponding change
is approved.

Change-Id: If6f77f86a3eeb08a58b516725bd806e39ccedb50

subject: Fix require_map_reduce mim import
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-16 18:51:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py'], 'message': "Fix require_map_reduce mim import

We don't import mim at the top level file anymore, so there's no way to
check against mim.Connection. And we can't blindly check for conn.conn since
other drivers like SQLAlchemy don't have a conn attributes. That's not part
of the Connection interface.

Change-Id: I25ea31d10bb7a28296676fbec4d2ad015d082cf1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix require_map_reduce mim import

We don't import mim at the top level file anymore, so there's no way to
check against mim.Connection. And we can't blindly check for conn.conn since
other drivers like SQLAlchemy don't have a conn attributes. That's not part
of the Connection interface.

Change-Id: I25ea31d10bb7a28296676fbec4d2ad015d082cf1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Fixes bug #1121605

This patch replacest the nvp_controller_connection configuration option
with a set of options more intutitive to user which also avoid
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [DEFAULT] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Change-Id: Id5f84220122d7c5f3239e3333cb772247d1ed05e

subject: Don't print the empty table on list operations.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 05:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/utils.py'], 'message': "Don't print the empty table on list operations.

Changes to strutils.safe_encode cause the empty
table to be printed out when no objects are actually
retrieved.

This patch just adds a check of the object list length
before calling strutils.safe_encode, if the length is NOT
> 0 we just return like we used to.

Change-Id: I57930b5210c975baa7c4510fcf82b17157e17788
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't print the empty table on list operations.

Changes to strutils.safe_encode cause the empty
table to be printed out when no objects are actually
retrieved.

This patch just adds a check of the object list length
before calling strutils.safe_encode, if the length is NOT
> 0 we just return like we used to.

Change-Id: I57930b5210c975baa7c4510fcf82b17157e17788

        failing earlier.

commit_message:
Remove skips in test server rescue

* Remove skips test_rescued_vm_add_remove_security_group
* Fixes two issues
    1. In remove_security_group pass self.sg_name instead of sg_id which was
        failing earlier.
    2. Before executing unrescue server operation, the server status seems to
       be active hence the bug 1126257. So adding a rescue operation at the
       start of the test to fix the bug

Fixes bug 1126257

Change-Id: Ie79b94b9cde0f35bb4ea5955bc284139d85123cb

commit_message:
hypervisor-list use policy

Because the DB function requires admin context, if you set a policy
for the hypervisor-list function (compute_extension:hypervisors) to not
require admin the user must still be an admin.

If you set the policy to not require admin for hypervisor-list then
non-admin users should be able to run hypervisor-list.

This change makes it so that the administrator can set the policy
to non-admin if that's appropriate for their setup.

Change-Id: I8e09c17405d3b3e356acbe863a62f87c00346d4f

commit_message:
allow policy for host-describe

The implementation for host-describe requires that the user is an
administrator and the policy setting for compute_extension:hosts
wasn't applied.

An administrator should be able to set the policy so that
non-administrators can do host-describe if that's appropriate for
their environment.

This changes the implementation so that the compute_extension:hosts
policy applies to host-describe so that non-admins can do
host-describe if that's how the policy is configured.

Change-Id: Ifbea8dff4a29821c5919c1499db18c09e685db8e

commit_message:
host-list use policy

Because the DB function requires an admin context, if you set a
policy for the host-list function (compute_extension:hosts) to not
require admin the user must still be an admin.

If you set the policy to not require admin for host-list then non-
admin users should be able to run host-list.

This change makes it so that the administrator can set the policy
to non-admin if that's appropriate for their setup.

Fixes bug 1168488

Change-Id: I1d2e5908deefa4445ed010485e245c7cd2bac63a

Add fixed-ip and floating-ip commands

Adds:

commit_message:
Make CLI tests python2.6 compatible

- adds setUpClass method to tempest.test.BaseTestCase
  to provide it instead of unittest.TestCase
- adds replacement for subprocess.check_output and CalledProcessError
- also ensures closing of devnull provided to check_output

Change-Id: I90382f8553baabc592a2bf7008d591d83f89f416

commit_message:
Fix bug in db.instance_type_destroy

Fix db.instance_type_destroy()
Corresponding instance_type_projects weren't deleted

Fix db.instance_type_acces_get_by_flavor_id method
Return [] list if there is no such instance_type
instead of AttributeError

Fixes bug 1172153

Change-Id: Ib1a9a23aa6e26711c198bf4a5059797044c44426

commit_message:
Move get_backdoor_port to base rpc API.

Each service implemented the get_backdoor_port method individually.  This
patch moves the implementation of this method to the base rpc API
instead, and removes the now unnecessary code from each of the services.
The server side method was left on all of the managers for rpc backwards
copmatibility.  They can be removed on the next major rpc version bump
of those APIs.

Part of blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: Ia8838fafd80eb86a1c2d66f5e97370042d8d8c53

Adds image `create` and `delete` functionality.

yet exist in the V2 API in glanceclient.

For blueprint glance-client.

commit_message:
Functional tests use a clean cached db that is only created once.

This eliminates the need for 'glance-manage db_sync' to be called
once (and often twice) for every test.  db_sync is an expensive
operation because it must walk through ever database migration.
With this patch, the first time the db is created it is cached
before it is used.  Instead of creating the db in future tests
the cached file is copied.  An atexit() function is used to clean
up the file when the tests are complete.

fixes bug: 1172475
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: I96e35c640256bf27ff17da0b5f558bda02906a07

commit_message:
Set the port of S3_URL to 8080 with swift3 enabled

Fixes: bug #1171608
The value of the port defaults to 3333 which is the
default for nova-objectstore.

Change-Id: If87df6a765bcfc4d467628411dceec72d5af412e

subject: Read metadata from local heat-cfntools cache
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-25 17:20:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Read metadata from local heat-cfntools cache

Heat writes to /var/lib/heat-cfntools/cfn-init-data , and heat-cfntools
writes the last metadata it read to
/var/cache/heat-cfntools/last_metadata. We expect to run on first boot,
which is why we need the heat version. Then we also expect to run after
cfn-hup notices changes, so that is where the last_metadata comes from.

Change-Id: I781c74a10b419f84c6983ed2b4d54b47bfa7b605

commit_message:
Read metadata from local heat-cfntools cache

Heat writes to /var/lib/heat-cfntools/cfn-init-data , and heat-cfntools
writes the last metadata it read to
/var/cache/heat-cfntools/last_metadata. We expect to run on first boot,
which is why we need the heat version. Then we also expect to run after
cfn-hup notices changes, so that is where the last_metadata comes from.

Change-Id: I781c74a10b419f84c6983ed2b4d54b47bfa7b605

commit_message:
Make main() return rather than call sys.exit

Fixes tests not all being run and also makes main() more directly
testable. Also adding tests for log messages when main() is called.
Finally adding argparse to requirements.txt to fix python 2.6

Change-Id: I7f152c9aa1e99d0fd3d763871c96cf60840e3ff7

commit_message:
Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally
useful.  Other methods will be added in later patches.

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless
they override the create_rpc_dispatcher method in the base manager
class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager
constructor.  Some services already did this, but now it's needed for
all of them.

Implements blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: I02ab1970578bc53ba26461b533d06d1055c2d88e

commit_message:
Fix powervm driver resize instance error

During a resize operation in powervm, the logical volume
of the instance will be copied and compressed to a file.
Current logic decompresses it twice before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance to not
boot properly.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2

commit_message:
Fix NameError: name '_' is not defined

During running unit tests, I get this error:
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/cells/rpcapi.py", line 27, in <module>
     from nova import exception
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/exception.py", line 123, in <module>
     class NovaException(Exception):
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/exception.py", line 131, in NovaException
     message = _("An unknown exception occurred.")
  NameError: name '_' is not defined

Change-Id: I6c75e8241675895c1bd35baa48d5383c726fe585

commit_message:
Ceilometer configuration.rst file not using right param names for logging

configuration.rst file lists all the configuration parameters for ceilometer
configuration. However, for logging, these parameter names should be log_dir
and log_file, but currently it is logdir and logfile.

The table also misses log_config.

There should be a link in configuration.rst file to point a user to the
sample configuration file.

Change-Id: Ic96f303ee7e30faf23c0a6433af5cb5111d35616
fixes: bug #1171905

commit_message:
Translate NoMoreFloatingIps exception

When the pool of floating ips is exhausted the NoMoreFloatingIps exception
is raised but not handled properly in the floating ips extension resulting
in the exception propagating further up and causing a stack trace to be logged.

This change translates the exception explicitly into a HTTPNotFound, preserving the current
REST API behaviour. It fixes a bug where the pool name was not correctly inserted into
the message returned if allocation from a specific pool was requested.

Fixes bug 1169811

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: I8f35d25d065bb1fa709cff6f59841ac8c86658bd

subject: Document image cache manager flag for compute nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-25 06:15:16.000000000', 'files': ['doc/src/docbkx/openstack-compute-admin/tables/compute-nodes-nova-conf.xml', 'doc/src/docbkx/openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml'], 'message': "Document image cache manager flag for compute nodes

In Folsom, image cache manager is disabled by default for compute nodes.
It's related to this bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1078594 when we use shared storage.

For infrastructures that don't use shared storage, it's very important to change this default from 0 to a defined value.
Otherwise, you could have some issue with disk space on your compute nodes after a while.

Fix bug #1172580

Change-Id: Ib6400d0b0a40cd4eb4911e9deefef14e33f18912
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Document image cache manager flag for compute nodes

In Folsom, image cache manager is disabled by default for compute nodes.
It's related to this bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1078594 when we use shared storage.

For infrastructures that don't use shared storage, it's very important to change this default from 0 to a defined value.
Otherwise, you could have some issue with disk space on your compute nodes after a while.

Fix bug #1172580

Change-Id: Ib6400d0b0a40cd4eb4911e9deefef14e33f18912

commit_message:
Shares Service in Cinder.

This change adds the client side of shares service in Cinder.

Following CLI commands are supported:
    share-create        Creates new NAS storage (NFS or CIFS).
    share-delete        Deletes NAS storage.
    share-list          List all NAS shares.
    share-allow         Allow access to the share.
    share-deny          Deny access to a share.
    share-show          Show details about a NAS share.
    share-snapshot-create
                        Add a new snapshot.
    share-snapshot-delete
                        Remove a snapshot.
    share-snapshot-list
                        List all the snapshots.
    share-snapshot-show
                        Show details about a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ib49fbe6417152571a5c64a94427b9ebf2081559b

commit_message:
Add stats reporting to Nexenta Driver

Nexenta driver was never updated to report stats.
This change doesn't include support for backend_name assignment
via configs, there's some other work that will need to be
done to enable that.

Fixes bug: 1166607

Change-Id: Id9cfff24df8815a67e42393aa18fd41ac1b9e6b3

commit_message:
Send 400 error if device specification contains unexpected attributes

This patch simply enhances the validator for the 'devices' attribute
by verifying each element in the device list does not contain
unexpected attributes.

commit_message:
Reorganize & split child functions into a child server

Instead of having the process launcher class be the one starting
child processes, keeping track of them, as well as having the functions
that the child process uses, it seems better to have the main process
launcher class only care about starting, tracking, and terminating child
servers and have the child functionality be separated.

Change-Id: I4b04aa2215050911bd0c873111cafc003b91d952

commit_message:
Avoid calling sudo in install_venv_common.py.

Updates our common venv installation routine so that it no longer
attempts to automatically install missing RPM packages via sudo
and instead just prints an error message and dies.

The primary motivation here was to avoid sudo altogether since
some people would rather not have the test suite run these sorts
of systems admin commands for them.

Change-Id: I350e5421a4dd3094217270d39547acaea0aeda3b

commit_message:
Add middleware to limit size of HTTP requests.

Adds a new RequestBodySizeLimiter middleware to guard against
really large HTTP requests. The default max request size is 112k
although this limit is configurable via the 'max_request_body_size'
config parameter.

Change-Id: I76248feed5c77f678b8a43f364d4f1e0794ab910

Add enforcement for foreign key contraints with sqlite

Fixes bug 1171732

When creating an engine the called can indicate whether or
not to enforce the constraints for sqlite.

commit_message:
Import and convert to oslo loopingcall.

Import the oslo looping call implementation (which is a copy of
nova's), delete nova's local copy, convert all users to the new
location.

It should be noted that the oslo implementation of
FixedIntervalLoopingCall measures time from the start of the
periodic task, not the end, so periodic tasks will run with a
constant frequency instead of the frequency changing depending on
how long the periodic task takes to run.

Change-Id: Ia62ce1988f5373c09146efa6b3b1d1dc094d50c4

commit_message:
Fixes test in response to optional hostname fix

Several tests have had their behavior changed
with the client appending the default host.
With that new behavior reversed in the client,
some tests use a username that contains an @,
causing an ambiguous case for the API to parse.
Deliberately including the host in the tests
fixes this.

Fixes Bug #1171559

Change-Id: I967eb4b21d8ca3e2c2721db6f362b8dac2551346

[{'created': '2013-04-23 21:00:06.000000000', 'files': ['MAINTAINERS'], 'message': 'Add a MAINTAINERS file

Following on from discussions at the summit, add a file which explains
the idea of oslo-core being a group of generalists and that each API
in the incubator should have a specialist maintainer.

I've made a quick stab at capturing the status of APIs where its most
obvious. I'm thinking we let people submit changes to add themselves

Change-Id: I5e67f94dc77f14849dea425dec51896fed0d07ef
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a MAINTAINERS file

Following on from discussions at the summit, add a file which explains
the idea of oslo-core being a group of generalists and that each API
in the incubator should have a specialist maintainer.

I've made a quick stab at capturing the status of APIs where its most
obvious. I'm thinking we let people submit changes to add themselves
to the file so they're on record saying "I'll maintain this".

Change-Id: I5e67f94dc77f14849dea425dec51896fed0d07ef

subject: Prevent WantReadError when using https
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 18:04:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Prevent WantReadError when using https

If the glance client is instantiated when the socket module has been
monkey patched requests to the server can yield a WantReadError because
the socket has been set to non-blocking but this is not being handled
correctly.

This change also means that eventlet's httplib will be used where
available (as is the case with python-swiftclient).

Fixes bug 1157864.

commit_message:
Prevent WantReadError when using https

If the glance client is instantiated when the socket module has been
monkey patched requests to the server can yield a WantReadError because
the socket has been set to non-blocking but this is not being handled
correctly. When this is the case use eventlet's GreenConnection which
handles non-blocking sockets correctly.

Also, for now, add a required getsockopt method to GreenConnection.
This can be removed once the eventlet fix
(https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/commits/609f230) lands.

Fixes bug 1157864.

Change-Id: I187b69f75b8bcfe16facd41e69b1cd0490dae605

commit_message:
add database run check

check that the database that we think we should have used actually
created a log directory, which means it was installed. Not a
perfect check, but a starting point for double entry accounting
so that devstack changes don't break us.

Change-Id: Ib7302894bfeb1016b15eba9e82312a7a915604fa

commit_message:
This is the first pass of a Centos;RHEL;Fedora version.

The process needs validation.

Patch set adds phrases to further separate distros.

Patch set goes through basic-install_controller-common.xml
with fixes during testing.

commit_message:
Remove quantum_connection_host parameter

quantum_connection_host parameter was not expected to work anyway
due to a typo in the logic in the class. quantum_connection_host
was removed from OpenStack with the release of Folsom.

It fixes a deprecation warning raised by Puppet:
Dynamic lookup of $quantum_host at nova/manifests/network/quantum.pp:27
is deprecated.

Additional changes:
* Remove commented parameters which were not used
* Add rspec tests for nova::network::quantum

Change-Id: I1d83511b0487de5ae694dae2b89bc265f6af27ca

Make migration tests postgres & mysql friendly.

Add some session commits to prevent database deadlocks.
Force close all open sessions before performing tear down.
Use escaped parameter handling for raw sql statements.

commit_message:
Remove new constraint from migration downgrade.

Remove the foreign key constraint for user_id. Whilst it is a foreign
key the constraint was not set in the previous schema. Also sets the
columns names to unicode as they were in previous schema.

Fixes: bug 1169381
Change-Id: I9b1ac5305622d68a7e124ba8100a4b8166b43af0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary full resource audits at the end of resizes

Both confirm_resize and revert_resize ends with full resource audits
which is unnecessary, given that correct calculations can be made
using existing claims.

Resolves bug 1169982.

Change-Id: If0f91651605a95e73fdbf88aa18c279bfaf73b04

This generic extra phase is handy for fixing up things like python
modules after pip is installed or other distro specific requirements.

For RHEL6, we add some post-prereq actions; a workaround for a hgtools
issue and install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies, overridding
the installed versions.

commit_message:
Add a generic post-prereq phase

This generic extra phase is handy for fixing up things like python
modules after pip is installed or other distro specific requirements.

Change-Id: I4a68b830cd98c6f93191dac1edd7de2a0381feaa

commit_message:
Fixes for mis-use of various exceptions

Changes to various the way various exceptions are raised. They are
all missing keyword args.

Fixes bug 1172220

Change-Id: I132d8a3b5b130b3a8e17fe49ba8800060325f811

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 02:19:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make os.services.update work with cells

WORK IN PROGRESS

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update work

In nova.compute.api:

 * Make update_service take host_name, binary_name -- instead of service_id
 * Rename some 'host' parameters to 'host_name' to be more explicit

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods that exist in normal HostAPI

 * Add service_get_by_args
 * Add service_update

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.5 to 1.6
 * Add call_host_api_method
 * Add cast_host_api_method

 These methods work similarly to their compute api counterparts, but don't assume the first param to be an instance_uuid. However it does assume the first param contains a cellname and an object (eg. host_name) of some sort, and passes the object straight on to the HostAPI in the target cell.

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-03-13 02:20:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make os.services.update work with cells

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update (enable/disable) service work

In nova.compute.api.api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods:

 * service_get_by_args - Not used yet
 * service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods:

 * service_get_by_args - Not used yet
 * service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.5 to 1.6
 * Add call_host_api_method
 * Add cast_host_api_method

 These methods work similarly to their compute api counterparts, but
 don't assume the first param to be an instance_uuid. However it does
 assume that the first parameter is a string usable by
 nova.cells.utils.split_cell_and_item.

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f

commit_message:
Make os.services.update work with cells

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update (enable/disable) service work

In nova.compute.api.api.HostAPI:

 Add - service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add - service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.6 to 1.7
 * Add service_update

Fixes bug #1150499

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f

subject: Fixes sorting on IP Address columns in tables.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 23:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/floating_ips/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/instances/tables.py', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.tables.js'], 'message': "Fixes sorting on IP Address columns in tables.

The jQuery tablesorter plugin was choosing the digit parser
instead of the ipAddress parser for the IP Address columns.
This caused those columns to not sort correctly since only the
first 2 octects were looked at for sorting.

This patch adds an 'ip' data attribute to these columns and
updates the set_table_sorting function to set the ipAddress
sorter when this attribute is present.

Fixes bug 1108085

Change-Id: I3ca05048ce43b5bda14a4c586146c7ec9e479a79
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes sorting on IP Address columns in tables.

The jQuery tablesorter plugin was choosing the digit parser
instead of the ipAddress parser for the IP Address columns.
This caused those columns to not sort correctly since only the
first 2 octects were looked at for sorting.

This patch adds an 'ip' data attribute to these columns and
updates the set_table_sorting function to set the ipAddress
sorter when this attribute is present.

Fixes bug 1108085

Change-Id: I3ca05048ce43b5bda14a4c586146c7ec9e479a79

commit_message:
Add Filter Action to Instance Views

The Instances page in both admin section and project
section doesn't support the filter action yet. This
feature is however implemented for the Projects page
and Users page. So added this feature to the Instances
page.

Fixes bug #1169084

Change-Id: I76e77a61f032e96f2d8d69a22d2caab2108c2aa8

commit_message:
Enhancement on prompts to list selected objects.

Used the display name from table.get_object_display(datum), instead
of explicitly looking for the first occurance of table header that
contains 'Name'.

Fallback mode: tables with no valid get_object_display(datum)
won't list selected objects.

Fixes bug 1155821

Change-Id: Iff4ee8500eb57f39a9bcb199c7eb2be7fa3e4ec4

subject: Fix regression on running manage command.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1816, 'name': 'Gabriel Hurley', 'email': 'gabriel.hurley@nebula.com', 'username': 'gabriel-hurley'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 5733, 'name': 'Kieran Spear', 'email': 'kispear@gmail.com', 'username': 'kspear'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 10:21:07.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-22 09:58:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Initial implementation of ceilometer-alarm

The implemented use case is raising an alarm (i.e. executing something)
as soon as a cumulative counter is above or below a certain threshold.

Alarms are stored in alarms.json inside the config directory.

The cumulative counter is compared to the alarm threshold with the
operator in "comparaison_operator" field of the alarm.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

When a alarm is triggered a shell script is executed, same things when the
alarm is untriggered

The used shell script are stored in fields "ok_action" and "alarm_action" of the
alarm description.

The alarm status stays in memory as long as the alarms aren't stored in a
persistante storage.

Change-Id: I2dfebc30a47576e83906a6d4011ce5d52041e901

as soon as a cumulative counter is above or below a certain threshold.

Alarms are stored in alarms.json inside the config directory.

The result of the "statistic" during a "period" is compared
to the alarm "threshold" with the operator in "comparaison_operator"
field of the alarm.

the statistic is calculated with get_meter_statistics() of the storage
connection.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

alarm is untriggered

alarm description.

The result of the "statistic" during a "period" is compared
to the alarm "threshold" with the operator in "comparaison_operator"
field of the alarm.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

When a alarm is triggered a URL is called, same things when the
alarm is untriggered

The URLs are stored in fields "ok_action" and "alarm_action" of the
alarm description.

commit_message:
Initial implementation of ceilometer-alarm

The implemented use case is raising an alarm (i.e. executing something)
as soon as a cumulative counter is above or below a certain threshold.

The result of the "statistic" during a "period" is compared
to the alarm "threshold" with the operator in "comparaison_operator"
field of the alarm.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

When a alarm is triggered a URL is called, same things when the
alarm is untriggered

The URLs are stored in fields "ok_action" and "alarm_action" of the
alarm description.

A api permit to made CRUD operation on the alarm.
This one update the DB and send a rpc message to ceilometer-alarm to
inform it for alarm creation/update/deletion.

This code is latest one for this prototype.
The summit have defined a more convenient way to acheive the alerting.

Change-Id: I2dfebc30a47576e83906a6d4011ce5d52041e901

commit_message:
Call monkey_patch before other modules are loaded

This patch moves the monkey_patch call into the glance scripts that
needs libs to be monkey_patched. This seems to be a good practice and
has given good results for other projects as well.

This change is needed  to avoid loading / initializing modules
before other libs are patched. For example: logging module.

Fixes bug 1163722

Change-Id: Idee486851606d765fb11598967a4f7d56cf46c97

commit_message:
Make deprecation-warning a debug-message

There's not much a 3rd party tool can do about this memcache
timeout-versus-time thing if it wants to support multiple versions of
Swift. So I just changed the warning message to a debug message so
it's at least easier to mute.

Change-Id: I9480a89a54af20c73b693ff358ff095363b459c7

subject: Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 06:22:23.000000000', 'files': ['quantum/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/midonet/test_midonet_plugin.py', 'quantum/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 00:43:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make the 'admin' role configurable

Bug 1158434

This patch adds a new policy named 'context_is_admin' which defines
an admin user as a collection of roles or else. The quantum context
has been updated to check for this policy when setting the is_admin

commit_message:
Make the 'admin' role configurable

Bug 1158434

This patch adds a new policy named 'context_is_admin' which defines
an admin user as a collection of roles or else. The quantum context
has been updated to check for this policy when setting the is_admin
flag.
This patch also adds a method for gathering 'admin' roles from policy
rules as current logic requires the context to be always populate with
the correct roles for admin rules, even when the context is implicitly
generated with get_admin_context or context.elevated.
Backward compatibility is ensuring by preserving the old behavior if
the 'context_is_admin' policy is not found in policy.json

Change-Id: I9acea75cca0c47e083a9149e358328ea3ca12d68

commit_message:
get context from req rather than getting a new admin context

This patch removes the call to context.get_admin_context() and instead
obtains the context from the req object. Allowing the context.auth_token
to be reused.

Fixes bug 1161081

Change-Id: I3b104edc2966fc3263fad824b1c4c99df832672e

commit_message:
iscsi: Add ability to specify or autodetect block vs fileio

When using block devices to back iSCSI logical units it is
advantageous to use blockio as it decreases latency and
increases throughput, effect is especially pronounced with
faster backing storage devices.

Change-Id: Ia8cba5ddfe140cb5732c2b9ad882831e812a44bc

commit_message:
Add cinder::db::postgresql class.

This allows Cinder to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

Change-Id: I3522d50935c81c8859c9f597df64aa0af6ca4e71

ensure postgresql actually runs on pg runs

need some deeper checks in devstack gate to make sure our working
environment looks like we think, but this should bring us back for
now.

after telling jay that we were creating and archiving mysql slow
logs on every run, I was found to be a liar. This turns out to be
because we did shell expansion at the wrong point and got the
following in cleanup:

+ sudo cp '/var/log/mysql/*' ....-devstack-vm-full/logs/mysql/
cp: cannot stat `/var/log/mysql/*': No such file or directory

Do a cp -a instead to not fail on shell expansion

commit_message:
fix copying the mysql logs on completion

after telling jay that we were creating and archiving mysql slow
logs on every run, I was found to be a liar. This turns out to be
because we did shell expansion at the wrong point and got the
following in cleanup:

+ sudo cp '/var/log/mysql/*' ....-devstack-vm-full/logs/mysql/
cp: cannot stat `/var/log/mysql/*': No such file or directory

Do a cp -a instead to not fail on shell expansion

Change-Id: Ifd20ba17f7ff7d528697fbadd9f1d0178e7e7767

Add nova::db::postgresql class.

This allows Nova to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

This allows Glance to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

subject: Add cinder::rabbitmq class.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-21 20:14:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add cinder::rabbitmq class.

Updates the cinder module so that it supports full Rabbitmq
configuration for the Cinder service. Previously the Cinder module
piggy-backed on the Nova module for its Rabbitmq configuration.

It is now possible to configure Cinder with its own Rabbitmq service/vhost/etc.

Change-Id: I1ce84d0716d333fe68d3a60ba7d7543c93a70ba3
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-22 01:39:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add cinder::rabbitmq class.

Updates the cinder module so that it supports full Rabbitmq
configuration for the Cinder service. Previously the Cinder module
piggy-backed on the Nova module for its Rabbitmq configuration.

It is now possible to configure Cinder with its own Rabbitmq service/vhost/etc.

NOTE: The default rabbit_password in the cinder module was set to 'guest' to
match what we do in cinder::rabbitmq and to avoid having to specify it
when using alternate messages queues (like qpid). I did however add a
warning if the default is used to potentially ward off accidentally
using the default when you don't mean to.

commit_message:
Add cinder::rabbitmq class.

Updates the cinder module so that it supports full Rabbitmq
configuration for the Cinder service. Previously the Cinder module
piggy-backed on the Nova module for its Rabbitmq configuration.

It is now possible to configure Cinder with its own Rabbitmq
service/vhost/etc.

Change-Id: I1ce84d0716d333fe68d3a60ba7d7543c93a70ba3

subject: Made colons quote-safe in logs; mainly for ipv6
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-20 04:27:14.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/proxy_logging.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_proxy_logging.py'], 'message': "Made colons quote-safe in logs; mainly for ipv6

Previous logging made a mess of ipv6 addresses. This just makes the
colon quote-safe so it passes through unscathed. The logs will still
be backward compatible because unquote don't care:

    $ python
    >>> from urllib import quote, unquote
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348')
    '2001%3Adb8%3A85a3%3A8d3%3A1319%3A8a2e%3A370%3A7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:')
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'

Change-Id: Ia13a9bc8a320cde5c56034a7f0b645913428bf21
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Made colons quote-safe in logs; mainly for ipv6

Previous logging made a mess of ipv6 addresses. This just makes the
colon quote-safe so it passes through unscathed. The logs will still
be backward compatible because unquote don't care:

    $ python
    >>> from urllib import quote, unquote
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348')
    '2001%3Adb8%3A85a3%3A8d3%3A1319%3A8a2e%3A370%3A7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:')
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'

Change-Id: Ia13a9bc8a320cde5c56034a7f0b645913428bf21

commit_message:
If rescue fails don't error the instance

If a rescue attempt fails, the VM's state should return to what it was
before the rescue attempt started, and the user should be notified of
the failure.

Fixes bug: 1170328

Change-Id: If5e97d06a3617adad83a4bba2ac6320616bbe83b

commit_message:
Encode consoleauth token in utf-8 to make it a str

This is needed for memcached backend, because the key cannot be a
unicode object in any of the exposed functions.

Fixes bug 1164784

Co-authored-by: Stanislaw Pitucha <stanislaw.pitucha@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ieb1429116d96eefe97564fe92631063dc16117cb

CINDER_DRIVER=glusterfs

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS Cinder driver

The GlusterFS volume driver can be used with Cinder by setting the
following in localrc:

CINDER_DRIVER=glusterfs
CINDER_GLUSTERFS_SHARES="127.0.0.1:/vol1;127.0.0.1:/vol2"

Shares are <host>:<volume> and separated by semicolons.

Change-Id: Iaa105233c9fce8d8fda0a9ea447e045b8d010db7

commit_message:
Correct disk's over committed size computing error

There's a error in the disk's over committed size computing for the
instance which using RAW type disk. This issue caused
disk_available_least resource counting increasing.

Fixes bug: 1167695

Change-Id: I4e6cf22a9cf66a757e3641e2a0be0b7699cae69d
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Raise 404 while deleting a deleted image

Fixes bug 1171469

Currently the glance v1 api raises a HTTPForbidden when a user tries
to delete an already deleted image. It should be raising a HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: I79f83782739bf40f3baba293cbc17fe04ca020bb

subject: Add an rpc API common to all services.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 18:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/manager.py', 'nova/cells/manager.py', 'nova/cert/manager.py', 'nova/console/manager.py', 'nova/manager.py', 'nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/test_baserpc.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/baserpc.py'], 'message': "Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally
useful.  Other methods will be added in later patches.

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless
they override the create_rpc_dispatcher method in the base manager
class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager
constructor.  Some services already did this, but now it's needed for
all of them.

Implements blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: I57c6183e38c7ac5613e1281054a506dc84c7e382
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally
useful.  Other methods will be added in later patches.

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless
they override the create_rpc_dispatcher method in the base manager
class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager
constructor.  Some services already did this, but now it's needed for
all of them.

Implements blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: I57c6183e38c7ac5613e1281054a506dc84c7e382

subject: Fix attach volume detect in euca test
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 01:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['exercises/euca.sh'], 'message': 'Fix attach volume detect in euca test

Fixes test for detecting when a volume has been successfully
attached to an instance to not just rely on the state being
in-use, but also be marked as "attached". The attachment
state will be displayed when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27098/
goes through. The attachment state is not currently displayed
by euca-describe-volumes because of the extraneous data returned
by the API as per bug #1074901.

In the meantime the "attaching" status of the volume itself, rather
than the attachment state, suffices for the test to work properly, but in the long
term this will disappear as it is not a valid ec2 API state and
volumes will move straight to the in-use state.

Fixes bug #1170548

Change-Id: Id38f37e1a0efc991f60da35145f809d98b5f41cd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix attach volume detect in euca test

Fixes test for detecting when a volume has been successfully
attached to an instance to not just rely on the state being
in-use, but also be marked as "attached". The attachment
state will be displayed when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27098/
goes through. The attachment state is not currently displayed
by euca-describe-volumes because of the extraneous data returned
by the API as per bug #1074901.

In the meantime the "attaching" status of the volume itself, rather
than the attachment state, suffices for the test to work properly, but in the long
term this will disappear as it is not a valid ec2 API state and
volumes will move straight to the in-use state.

Fixes bug #1170548

Change-Id: Id38f37e1a0efc991f60da35145f809d98b5f41cd

commit_message:
Add string 'quantum'/ version to scope/tag in NVP

This patch adds scope='quantum', tag=QUANTUM_VERSION to each element
created in NVP via quantum. This patch also removes the function
set_tenant_id_tag() as it was only used in one place and wasn't very useful.

Fixes bug 1128674

Change-Id: I9f1f8e9b49154012a82d24e31cc9fb7f2df9c604

subject: Translate cinder NotFound exception
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-17 00:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/cinder.py', 'nova/tests/volume/test_cinder.py'], 'message': "Translate cinder NotFound exception

When we attempt to get information about a snapshot
which doesn't exist we get a cinder NotFound exception.
However, this is not caught and causes a stacktrace in the logs.
This occurs on every tempest run in the test
EC2VolumesTest.test_create_volume_from_snapshot.

The fix is to translate the exception to SnapshotNotFound
which is handled correctly further up the call chain.

Fixes bug 1169777

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: If893b5083b93894e671c978bd23bd89d3d017531
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Translate cinder NotFound exception

When we attempt to get information about a snapshot
which doesn't exist we get a cinder NotFound exception.
However, this is not caught and causes a stacktrace in the logs.
This occurs on every tempest run in the test
EC2VolumesTest.test_create_volume_from_snapshot.

The fix is to translate the exception to SnapshotNotFound
which is handled correctly further up the call chain.

Fixes bug 1169777

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: If893b5083b93894e671c978bd23bd89d3d017531

The hypervisor tests don't accurately model the db because the
sqlalchemy DB API requires admin for the compute_node_get_all
function.

This change makes it so that the fake compute_node_get_all
function in the hypervisor test module requires admin just like the
sqlalchemy DB function.

Change-Id: I5acd45cfbd10ec06d8c5a9425e9c6ed18cff669e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
hypervisor tests more accurate db

The hypervisor tests don't accurately model the db because the
sqlalchemy DB API requires admin for the compute_node_get_all
function.

This change makes it so that the fake compute_node_get_all
function in the hypervisor test module requires admin just like the
sqlalchemy DB function.

Change-Id: I5acd45cfbd10ec06d8c5a9425e9c6ed18cff669e

commit_message:
Add option to exclude joins from instance_get_by_uuid

Some callers of instance_get_by_uuid do not need the data that it joins
by default.  This allows the caller the choice of getting it or not.
Specifically in this case the _sync_power_state periodic task is pulling
it unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I48cc2ea1de993b87ce6f96f4877c8d8513f507e2

commit_message:
close db migration session

Explicitly close sessions in db migration 022. With the postgresql backend
if the session is not closed explicitly it leaves a user of the db behind
which can cause problems later on

Fixes bug #1158544

Change-Id: I389b83397addc5901aa94b584856fbd7f5cef485

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 09:58:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/baremetal/test_virtual_power_driver.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py'], 'message': 'baremetal: VirtualPowerDriver uses mac addresses in bm_interfaces

After the change I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880,
bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer set. However VPD still
uses it. This patch changes VPD to use bm_interfaces.address
instead of bm_nodes.prov_mac_address.

Fixes bug 1168574.

Change-Id: I2bab869b282958ee9fd0e4776928e56351018324
(cherry picked from commit 708ff76a993e48e17025c5c2d5451e2e49adc696)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
baremetal: VirtualPowerDriver uses mac addresses in bm_interfaces

After the change I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880,
bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer set. However VPD still
uses it. This patch changes VPD to use bm_interfaces.address
instead of bm_nodes.prov_mac_address.

Fixes bug 1168574.

Change-Id: I2bab869b282958ee9fd0e4776928e56351018324
(cherry picked from commit 708ff76a993e48e17025c5c2d5451e2e49adc696)

commit_message:
Get rid of create state in Instance

We don't want to store any state in the Instance object, instead take
advantage of the new mechanism whereby the result of handle_create() is
passed to check_active().

This makes the autoscaling code uglier for now (since it must still store
the instance state in the instance), but this will go away when we move to
using co-routines to create resources in parallel.

Change-Id: Ib11c8da22900453eb9713eba5106859c8a09dbe2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 19:58:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Get rid of create state in Autoscaling

Avoid storing the state of instances that are currently being created in
the instance group resource itself. Instead, ensure that they are returned
from handle_create() and take advantage of that result being passed back in
to check_active().

Change-Id: Ie2c75eaee620aa0599665168bfb92b345128d392
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-09 21:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/autoscaling.py'], 'message': 'Get rid of create state in Autoscaling

Avoid storing the state of instances that are currently being created in
the instance group resource itself. Instead, ensure that they are returned
from handle_create() and take advantage of that result being passed back in
to check_active().

Change-Id: Ie2c75eaee620aa0599665168bfb92b345128d392
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Get rid of create state in Autoscaling

Avoid storing the state of instances that are currently being created in
the instance group resource itself. Instead, ensure that they are returned
from handle_create() and take advantage of that result being passed back in
to check_active().

Change-Id: Ie2c75eaee620aa0599665168bfb92b345128d392

commit_message:
Fix pyflakes-bypass for PyFlakes 0.7

Don't make assumptions about argument types, get the line number from the
message object.

Fixes bug #1171420

Change-Id: Id0b1b254a1561941dea8ab5bb23aea1f936e7f0b

commit_message:
Remove service _user, _password, _tenant from context

These are not currently used anywhere in heat-engine, and I'm
not comfortable with the service password going over the (controller)
network.

If heat-engine needs access to these in the future then they can always
be configured in heat-engine.conf, or the operation can be performed
in the api and the results put into the context.

Change-Id: I81aab6b5a2c9aa7d6412531f70108857cbfa637b

subject: Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 04:29:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini

keystone auth_token middleware now allows heat to have auth_token
configuration in heat-api.conf. This commit moves the example of
auth_token configuration from heat-api-paste.ini to heat-api.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit heat-api-paste.ini.

This change does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/heat/heat-api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already uses heat-api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

commit_message:
Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini

keystone auth_token middleware now allows heat to have auth_token
configuration in heat-api.conf. Moves the example of
auth_token configuration from heat-api-paste.ini to heat-api.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit heat-api-paste.ini.

This does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/heat/heat-api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already uses heat-api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

Change-Id: Ia0a4d912cd7380094e121ee4af733277ca4d812e
Blueprint: keystone-middleware

subject: Subclass keystone middleware to set headers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-08 04:29:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Subclass keystone middleware to set headers

This replaces our old forked auth_token with a subclass
of keystoneclient middleware.

The advantages of moving to keystoneclient middleware:
- can use v3 (or v2) keystone api
- PKI tokens
- token revocation

The subclass sets the following headers to be consumed by our
request context filter:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

The need to override _build_user_headers should be a short-term thing,
X-Admin-* isn't actually used currently, and there are a few options
that need to be discussed for getting X-Auth-Url to the engine.

This also sets a default signing_dir for pki key signing. Without this,
PKI token authentication doesn't work.
Devstack will set this value to /var/cache/heat

Change-Id: Iacc5046fbf559724a4ae0bd6091d662e23d65544
Blueprint: keystone-middleware
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-08 23:31:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Subclass keystone middleware to set headers

This replaces our old forked auth_token with a subclass
of keystoneclient middleware.

The advantages of moving to keystoneclient middleware:
- can use v3 (or v2) keystone api
- PKI tokens
- token revocation

The subclass sets the following headers to be consumed by our
request context filter:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

The need to override _build_user_headers should be a short-term thing,
X-Admin-* isn't actually used currently, and there are a few options
that need to be discussed for getting X-Auth-Url to the engine.

This also sets a different default signing_dir for pki key signing for each API.
Without this, PKI token authentication won't work for heat deployed with
install.sh.

Devstack (and packaging) will set these values to
/var/cache/heat/(api|api-cfn|api-cloudwatch)

Change-Id: Iacc5046fbf559724a4ae0bd6091d662e23d65544
Blueprint: keystone-middleware

commit_message:
Subclass keystone middleware to set headers

Replace old forked auth_token with a subclass
of keystoneclient middleware.

The advantages of moving to keystoneclient middleware:
- can use v3 (or v2) keystone api
- PKI tokens
- token revocation

The subclass sets the following headers to be consumed by our
request context filter:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

The need to override _build_user_headers should be a short-term thing,
X-Admin-* isn't actually used currently, and there are a few options
that need to be discussed for getting X-Auth-Url to the engine.

Change-Id: Iacc5046fbf559724a4ae0bd6091d662e23d65544
Blueprint: keystone-middleware

commit_message:
Cache vcpu used num of domain in periodic task

blueprint cache-used-vcpu-of-domain
We saw the periodic task stopped running and blocked at getting
vcpu num of domain, and the vcpu num of domain will not be
changed util the hotplug of vcpu is supported by hypervisor,
so we needn't get it everytime in period task.
This bp is relative to bug 985489, it may be relieved but can't be
resolved eventually by this patch, so a bp is posted.

Change-Id: Id36fe5a7d40e291872dea4f9922db5a5cf82b865
