subject: Eliminate the race when selecting a port for tests.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6493, 'name': 'John Bresnahan', 'email': 'john@bresnahan.me', 'username': 'jbresnah'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 02:03:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Eliminate the race when selecting an available port in functional tests

Functional tests currently select ports on which the various services
will listen by opening a socket in the ephemeral port range, checking
its port, closing the socket, and then sometime later starting the
service and instructing it to use that port.  There are a few bugs
that reference fragile tests.  In many of these case it is possible that
another processes claimed the selected port in between the time it
was first opened and closed and the time that the service actually used
it.  Because this is a known possibility, and because the tests fail
infrequently resolving these bug becomes difficult.

This patch eliminates the window in which another processes could
claim the port.  The socket is opened in the test code but not closed.
Then the service process (api or registry) is forked off where it
inherits the open file descriptor.  A environment variable is used
to tell the new wsgi process that it is a test process and should thus
get its socket from the FD instead of creating a new socket.

In the case where glance-control is used with the --respawn option this
solution is not possible.  The problem is that the FD is only good
once.  I can pass from the test code, to glance-control, and to
glance-{api, registry} but only 1 time.  If the service dies, and
glance-control restarts it the FD will no longer be valid.  For this
case the forked FD code is disabled.  However, the socket is still
closed much later making the race condition even less likely.

This fixes bug: 1047593
It may fix some other "fragile test" bugs as well.

Change-Id: I27313d144bc7bd2132a604dcc22916c80338abab

Change-Id: I27313d144bc7bd2132a604dcc22916c80338abab
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Eliminate the race when selecting a port for tests.

Functional tests currently select ports on which the various services
will listen by opening a socket in the ephemeral port range, checking
its port, closing the socket, and then sometime later starting the
service and instructing it to use that port.  There are a few bugs that
reference fragile tests.  In many of these case it is possible that
another processes claimed the selected port in between the time it was
first opened and closed and the time that the service actually used it.
Because this is a known possibility, and because the tests fail
infrequently resolving these bug becomes difficult.

This patch eliminates the window in which another processes could claim
the port.  The socket is opened in the test code but not closed. Then
the service process (api or registry) is forked off where it inherits
the open file descriptor.  A environment variable is used to tell the
new wsgi process that it is a test process and should thus get its
socket from the FD instead of creating a new socket.

In the case where glance-control is used with the --respawn option this
solution is not possible.  The problem is that the FD is only good once.
I can pass from the test code, to glance-control, and to glance-{api,
registry} but only 1 time.  If the service dies, and glance-control
restarts it the FD will no longer be valid.  For this case the forked FD
code is disabled.  However, the socket is still closed much later making
the race condition even less likely.

This fixes bug: 1047593
It may fix some other "fragile test" bugs as well.

Change-Id: I27313d144bc7bd2132a604dcc22916c80338abab

commit_message:
Add a policy handler to control copy-from functionality

This patch adds the ability to set a policy handler to control what
users can use the 'copy_from' feature in the v1 API.

Fixes bug: 1153614

Change-Id: Ie194979a2aa66c9327bf14d7a85ead6f773a6079

commit_message:
Shares Service in Cinder.

Introduces the new 'Shares' service inside Cinder. Special care
has been taken to have a minimum overlap with the existing code,
and to not modify the existing methods much.

The new shares service allows creation/deletion of shares
(NFS and CIFS) and provides allowing/denying access for a share to
a particular IP. Creating snapshots of shares, and creating a share
from a snapshot is also supported. Drivers for Linux LVM and
NetApp 7-mode storage controller are provided. Drivers for other
vendors can be added easily based on the provided framework.

Change-Id: Ifea0e7fd16e8a36b41898e761175496bd36154c5

commit_message:
Move yes/no strings to constants

Instead of having function level (and repeated) constants
for boolean values, just have a single set of contants for
these values, and share them in the various functions.

Change-Id: I6af013e849e1c6cf1bfd944a8f81dbd46abac70d

commit_message:
Enable debug logging in q-agt output

when only q-agt is used, without q-svc, typically in a multi-host config, q-agt wasn't logging debug output.
This change enable debug output, as it's done for q-l3, q-dhcp or q-meta agent.

Change-Id: I1f49cf9994fa9cfbaa166dac8d4e713ba99c5674
Fixes: bug #1166775

commit_message:
Can now reboot rescued instances in xenapi

This patch makes it possible to reboot an instance that is in rescue mode.

It causes the reboot action to search first for rescue mode VM (the
normal VMs name plus '-rescue') .. if it can't find it, it does a reboot
of the normal VM. If it finds the rescue one first, it'll reboot the
rescue instance.

If there is more than one VM named 'myvm-rescue', it'll raise an
exception just like it did if there were more than one VM named 'myvm'.

Helps with bug: 1170237

Change-Id: I1858d86bf93546618eeaaec92d856f5236f3f090

commit_message:
Allows xenapi 'lookup' to look for rescue mode VMs

When you lookup a VM by name, you can specify if you want it to check if
it has a rescue mode instance running.

If it finds the rescue mode instance, it'll return that one instead
of the original name.

This is useful for operations that should work on the rescue mode vm if
it's there, or the normal one, if it's not.

Work towards bug: 1170237
Change-Id: I41b31e59631b78a62faadb9970b6b824929e7061

commit_message:
Stop vm_state reset on reboot of rescued vm

When a VM is in rescue mode, giving it a reboot will reset its state in
the DB back to ACTIVE.

This patch stops that happening.

Work towards bug: 1170237
Change-Id: Ie442bcc85ed7ad5d897b88ffd0dbcf6eeee7b990

construct. the except x as y: construct works with
all python 2.6+ versions

commit_message:
Adds support for post-install scripts.

Post install scripts are useful because they can perform tasks you want
to handle after the OS/application install but before the first boot
of the image. e.g: Clean the cache left by the package manager reducing
the size of the image.

Change-Id: I03e77f602192bbdce29c02999d1b57fac8051ddc
Fixes: Bug #1145786

Change default passwords in boot-stack to 'unset'.

This is intended to make it more obvious that default
passwords are in use.

commit_message:
Install pip requirements from pypi.openstack.org.

While `setup.py`s were being installed from the openstack
pypi mirror, `pip-requires` were coming from pypi.python.org,
which has been observed to be less stable.

This change installs all pip-requires via pypi.openstack.org.

Change-Id: Id78110232f1f6cbce63fbe02c63f30c0e1953212

commit_message:
Use nova from the tripleo fork.

The tripleo nova fork contains two important patches,
(noted in source comments), which are currently awaiting merge upstream.

The nova element should switch back to using trunk nova once these
changes have landed.

This change required removing a silent translation of
`s/github.com/review.openstack.org/'.

Change-Id: Ia317823eee09afad2570f2b5678b35a018fe88f8

commit_message:
Rename duplicate test method

test_get_method_unknown_controller_action was defined twice,
checking however for different things. Rename the 2nd instance
to test_get_method_undefined_controller_action instead, otherwise
it gets overwritten later and not run. Increases test coverage

Change-Id: I64b62560d6db9f6378df8fbc21bd9fada5088b89

commit_message:
Cleanup and test volume usage on volume detach

* Refactor _poll_volume_usage to be more readable

* Test that detaching a volume updates the totals on the volume usage
  cache correctly. This works but adding test to make sure that it always
  works.

commit_message:
Fix functional test 'test_scrubber_with_metadata_enc'

This test fails if a real swift system is specified in a config file
and passed to the tests via the GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment
variable. The fix is to allow location schemes of the form
'swift+http' as well as 'swift+https'.

Fixes bug 1158805

Change-Id: I9fd3a9c02b31acc2a8313acd3b88124a17d0adfb

commit_message:
Verify SSL certificates at boot time

When Glance is configured to run with SSL this patch will check
that the certificate and key exist, are readable, and match each
other at boot time.  If any of the above conditions fail an friendly
error message is logged directing the operator at a solution.
Previously the keys were not checked until a client connected.

fixes bug: 1160529

Change-Id: I16975608f9ae40ac5b84b3caa52ed5f8e22f296e

commit_message:
Fix Qpid test cases

The Qpid notification test cases do not currently pass.
By default they are skipped because qpid is not part of
test-requires, so it isn't automatically installed.  This fix
updates the test cases to work correctly, but does not add
qpid to test-requires because I'm unsure what impacts that
might have on other platforms.

This is part of the fix for bug 1164681

Change-Id: I40757b5de99559b4ff090e0d249f8624c2e2be10

a 'pending_delete' image, and does not change
its status.

commit_message:
Revert common logging use in rootwrap

Revert recent plug of common logging into rootwrap, as it breaks
rootwrap logging. Rootwrap does not make use of oslo logging and oslo
config in order to reduce the surface of code run as root.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26468/ for discussion.

Change-Id: I276ade164a902d091f9aafab79bbd4cc189588eb

commit_message:
Make Paste use default configs

Instead of specifying a custom location for the Marconi configuration file
through Paste, just use the defaults as specified by our config module.

Change-Id: Ia01e262e298f953412a36c75614c7656c3105db1
Implements: blueprint config-module

commit_message:
Add GridFS store

This patch adds support for GridFS to glance. GridFS is 10gen's, mongodb
based, distributed filesystem.

The store requires 2 options in order to work correctly:
    * mongodb_store_uri
    * mongodb_store_db

Note: mongodb was used in the parameters name's even though this store
supports `gridfs://` schemas (not official) in order to keep consistency
with mongodb's documentation and connection parameters.

GridFS StoreLocations:

This store implements gridfs locations with the form `gridfs://<IMAGE>`.
Note that there's no connection information in those uris, which was
consciously omitted for security reasons. Perhaps, it could be possible
to make that information available by setting a configuration parameter
that specifies so.

Implements blueprint gridfs-store

Change-Id: I38f361ac8421f0445dd37800c840441a46cf9fdf

commit_message:
bug 1166263 image-update handling for closed stdin

handles the case where an image-update command is issued from a cron job with an
invalid standard input file descriptor: consider no image data is provided when
no --file option present.

Change-Id: I5eb3433311e5faf0a3fb7eb36f6a01e5df7efe4c

commit_message:
Stop appending default host if none is provided.

Appending the default hostname broke backward
compatibility. This change reverses that change.
Now, usernames with @ in them will need to
specify their host deliberately, but that is
a small edge case compared to every single
user call being modified without the client user's
knowing.

Fixes Bug #1171559

Change-Id: I2f2e9adc252e2b1cd03b1bb0c4a53d48d5c11e53

   settings and annotating the rest.

commit_message:
Updated the Swift installation steps for Grizzly

These changes were made following an installation of Swift and Keystone
on Ubuntu 12.04.2 using Ubuntu's Cloud Archive packages.

 * Some minor changes to "screen" blocks to introduce a space between
   "#" and the command to run.

 * Install python-keystoneclient rather than python-keystone-auth-token
   (the auth_token module moved during grizzly).

 * Install python-webob on the proxy server. It's required by
   auth_token.

 * Add instructions for creating the 'signing_dir' on the proxy server.

 * Use 'service' rather that 'swift-init' to start the various services.
   On reboot upstart will start the services anyway. Best to be
   consistent.

 * Removed instructions to create account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf and object-server.conf. These files come as
   part of the Ubuntu packages and work out of the box.

 * Moved the instructions on starting the object storage services into a
   new section following the installation of the ring files. They made
   no sense where they were as the services wouldn't start sucessfully
   until the ring files are in place.

 * Tidied up the sample proxy-server.conf.txt by removing unused
   settings and annotating the rest.

 * Added instructions to create the swift recon cache dir on each
   storage node

Change-Id: I8001849b0a492060d51f38be024b1acee569585b

commit_message:
Make list flavor show extra specs optional.

Flavor list will get each flavors extra_specs by making fresh requests to nova.
When there are lots of flavors, the flavor list will take a while to run. So
let us make show extra-specs optional.

Fix bug: #1166455

Change-Id: I86aef1035be6a88b8d9fb49a89f5a608a72589dd

Currently  HTTPClient creates a new TCP connection for each

commit_message:
Use HTTP keep-alive feature in HTTPClient class

Currently  HTTPClient creates a new TCP connection for each
API request. We could actually reuse created connections by
relying upon HTTP keep-alive feature.  That would enable us
to do a few queries in a row more efficiently.

Fixes bug 1170385.

Change-Id: Ie6d8fb9670938e3790017509a242630b67abd794

commit_message:
baremetal: Change input for sfdisk

To prevent sfdisk stopping with "bad input", use a empty string
instead of "-" (and doing so requires using "," as a separator).

Fixes bug 1166112

Change-Id: I5e4cffaa326fbafd1583d55744f921a40b3ae76f

commit_message:
Raise correct exception for duplicate networks

When using Quantum, if duplicate network ids are passed in on a
nova boot, nova-api raises a NetworkNotFound exception, which is
not correct.  This change causes it to raise a NetworkDuplicated
exception instead.

Fixes bug 1165088

Change-Id: I4f1f9aa5e1fa0e740b78e67760d924e2dd1d4d98

commit_message:
baremetal: VirtualPowerDriver uses mac addresses in bm_interfaces

After the change I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880,
bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer set. However VPD still
uses it. This patch changes VPD to use bm_interfaces.address
instead of bm_nodes.prov_mac_address.

Fixes bug 1168574.

Change-Id: I2bab869b282958ee9fd0e4776928e56351018324

subject: Fix pyflakes-bypass to work with pyflakes 0.7
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 11:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['tools/pyflakes-bypass.py'], 'message': 'Fix pyflakes-bypass to work with pyflakes 0.7

Fixes bug #1171420

In pyflakes 0.7, the first argument to checker.report() changed from a line
number to the AST node itself.

Assume the argument is an AST node, but if AttributeError is thrown when
referencing the lineno attribute then fall back to assuming its an integer
in order to support <0.7.

Change-Id: I878616f118f83dcf88b8cc00ac8ad0e8e5c665b2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix pyflakes-bypass to work with pyflakes 0.7

Fixes bug #1171420

In pyflakes 0.7, the first argument to checker.report() changed from a line
number to the AST node itself.

Assume the argument is an AST node, but if AttributeError is thrown when
referencing the lineno attribute then fall back to assuming its an integer
in order to support <0.7.

Change-Id: I878616f118f83dcf88b8cc00ac8ad0e8e5c665b2

commit_message:
attempt to get to flake8/hacking plugins

this is the infrastructure changes, plus 1 fix, to get us towards
flake8 and hacking plugins.

We need to remove an exit call in __init__ for config to get this
to pass. I think long term this gets addressed by config becoming
a test resource, but it will take some time at summit to figure
that out.

Change-Id: Iedd7931e85da5518cb2a8d58717e37b805267d2c

print function introduced in python 2.6. See:

subject: Simplify rpc client calls
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 11:29:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat/rpc/client.py'], 'message': "Simplify rpc client calls

We always pass host=None to _engine_topic() which means that we always
construct a topic using CONF.engine_topic and CONF.host.

And since RpcProxy methods falls back to the topic supplied to its
constructor, we never need to explicitly pass it.

We can safely remove the _engine_topic() method and the passing of an
explicit topic to RpcProxy methods and replace it with constructing the
correct topic at construction time, without causing any functional
changes.

While we're at it, replace the last use of the variable name FLAGS with
CONF.

Change-Id: Iefdc6b78a068975ac45b10d6b53210cb283d2ef8
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Simplify rpc client calls

We always pass host=None to _engine_topic() which means that we always
construct a topic using CONF.engine_topic and CONF.host.

And since RpcProxy methods falls back to the topic supplied to its
constructor, we never need to explicitly pass it.

We can safely remove the _engine_topic() method and the passing of an
explicit topic to RpcProxy methods and replace it with constructing the
correct topic at construction time, without causing any functional
changes.

While we're at it, replace the last use of the variable name FLAGS with
CONF.

Change-Id: Iefdc6b78a068975ac45b10d6b53210cb283d2ef8

subject: Fix warnings in storage/server.pp.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-21 02:31:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/storage/server.pp'], 'message': 'Fix warnings in storage/server.pp.

Updates the swift storage/server class so that we quote $pipeline
before doing a comparison check for the server type. This fixes
an issue where warnings would always get printed when using the
default $pipeline variable.

Fixes LP Bug #1171052.

Change-Id: I3076b6110f1a42c0e6c179d18952b0b013908f01
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix warnings in storage/server.pp.

Updates the swift storage/server class so that we quote $pipeline
before doing a comparison check for the server type. This fixes
an issue where warnings would always get printed when using the
default $pipeline variable.

Fixes LP Bug #1171052.

Change-Id: I3076b6110f1a42c0e6c179d18952b0b013908f01

Expose "protected" attribute of images.

Adds support for displaying and setting the protected
attribute on images.  If images are protected, delete
actions are not enabled

Fixes bug 1168067

if attribution info of resource didn't include it.

Because agent's attribution info didn't include 'tenant_id',
that cause BadRequest error when invoke 'Controller._verify_attributes'
after 'Controller._populate_tenant_id' added 'tenant_id' to request params
from request context.

Change-Id: If18218e6d611011c62fd19a639c386cd672767a2
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-04-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Returns 501 instead of 404 for agent's non-implemented action

Part of bug fix 1146586

Change-Id: If18218e6d611011c62fd19a639c386cd672767a2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Returns 501 instead of 404 for agent's non-implemented action

Part of bug fix 1146586

Modify 'Controller._populate_tenant_id' won't add 'tenant_id' field
if attribution info of resource didn't include it.

Because agent's attribution info didn't include 'tenant_id',
that cause BadRequest error when invoke 'Controller._verify_attributes'
after 'Controller._populate_tenant_id' added 'tenant_id' to request params
from request context.

Change-Id: If18218e6d611011c62fd19a639c386cd672767a2

subject: Fix a comment formatting to make pep8 test pass
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-21 18:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['quantumclient/v2_0/client.py'], 'message': "Fix a comment formatting to make pep8 test pass

New version of pyflakes does checking of doctests. We have a
comment that looks like a doctest, but in fact it's not. This
makes pep8 test fail.

Fixes bug 1170639.

Change-Id: Iee4f1bb8fd8284c6d1bb0111e23a61f434f3f457
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix a comment formatting to make pep8 test pass

New version of pyflakes does checking of doctests. We have a
comment that looks like a doctest, but in fact it's not. This
makes pep8 test fail.

Fixes bug 1170639.

Change-Id: Iee4f1bb8fd8284c6d1bb0111e23a61f434f3f457

commit_message:
Add gettext install.

When we pulled this from nova, the gettext.install went away, but it
turns out that it's super important, otherwise the import test gets
messed up by _ and our assumption that it gets imported from the
execution entrypoints in bin/ and the test runner.

Change-Id: I7e51d93c44af9f08d7177097c3992127d5851ce0
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/26970
Reviewed-by: Joe Gordon <jogo@cloudscaling.com>
Approved: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

[{'created': '2013-04-19 05:54:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't require flat_inferface.

The nova default for flat_interface is None but our puppet modules
currently require it to be set. This patch updates the flatdhcp
module so that it defaults to undef thus making it possible to use
nova::network w/ flatdhcp when no flat_interface(private_interface) is
defined.

Fixes LP Bug #1170569.

Change-Id: I62b91d9aef652c9d6b0a9e344832f6bef2bc3f27
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-04-20 19:56:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/network/flatdhcp.pp'], 'message': "Don't require flat_inferface.

The nova default for flat_interface is None but our puppet modules
currently require it to be set. This patch updates the flatdhcp
module so that it defaults to undef thus making it possible to use
nova::network w/ flatdhcp when no flat_interface(private_interface) is
defined.

Fixes LP Bug #1170569.

Change-Id: I62b91d9aef652c9d6b0a9e344832f6bef2bc3f27
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't require flat_inferface.

The nova default for flat_interface is None but our puppet modules
currently require it to be set. This patch updates the flatdhcp
module so that it defaults to undef thus making it possible to use
nova::network w/ flatdhcp when no flat_interface(private_interface) is
defined.

Fixes LP Bug #1170569.

Change-Id: I62b91d9aef652c9d6b0a9e344832f6bef2bc3f27

subject: Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 05:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py'], 'message': 'Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78

Fedora element installs redhat-lsb-core, not redhat-lsb.

redhat-lsb was pulling in over 100 unnecessary dependencies.

commit_message:
Allow event reporting to be turned off.

In order to reduce the amount of conductor and db traffic
at least allow the option to turn off event reporting so
that if the database overload it causes is problematic it
can just be flipped off.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2b82db4417636ae22c8baffc5c6d6cfb6b76f30e

subject: Limit the checks for block device becoming available.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 17:35:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Limit the checks for block device becoming available.

Instead of previously looping potentially forever for a block
device mapping to become created from the volume api, basically
blocking a greenthread until this happens we now will have a number
of attempts (defaulting to 10) that we will wait for the volume api
to create said block device mapping (or error out).

Fixes bug 1162064

Change-Id: I6ff0b42aad48df735d09f91a0a9fe98e6abcf2eb
(cherry picked from commit 24aacd2c91c73245d444a2460ded1c5c94382f5f)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Limit the checks for block device becoming available.

Instead of previously looping potentially forever for a block
device mapping to become created from the volume api, basically
blocking a greenthread until this happens we now will have a number
of attempts (defaulting to 10) that we will wait for the volume api
to create said block device mapping (or error out).

Fixes bug 1162064

Change-Id: I6ff0b42aad48df735d09f91a0a9fe98e6abcf2eb
(cherry picked from commit 24aacd2c91c73245d444a2460ded1c5c94382f5f)

commit_message:
Backported VolumeHostAttribute API extension

Expose the host on which a volume resides through a new API
extension. This is only presented to Admins by default. This
can be controlled with the 'volume_host_attribute' policy
rule.

Conflicts:

	etc/cinder/policy.json

Change-Id: Iee2d69ba051765b734494a9637ddd73e07db1e22

commit_message:
Backport lockutils, fileutils to Folsom.

NetApp drivers require locking mechanism to be present in
Folsom version. So this commit backports it.

This commit also includes some recent security fixes to
lockutils file, including:

3cb71ff Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist
21925b6 Fix locking issues in Windows
547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation

Fix bug 1158179

Change-Id: I477237c01420ca555806cdfc91956e297ddbc747

commit_message:
Unify services and hosts API

Update requests accept wrapped entities (i.e.,
{"host":{...}} instead of {...}). All returned entities
are wrapped in the same way. This 'wrapping' behavour is
used in other parts of Nova API.

Host power actions are now POST, not GET, because they
change host state.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If50a6b6e20f9b3fe66d486bb9b15d3eb4b62daf9

commit_message:
Fixes running horizon on fedora 18 and above

Fixes bug: 1167066
Summary:

1. Starting with fedora 18 the httpd.conf has
    <Directory />
        AllowOverride none
        Require all denied
    </Directory>
  which requires you to explicitly permit access to web content
  directories in other <Directory> blocks

2. Install nodejs on fedora 18 and above

Change-Id: I487a7a74bad6627d32c1081dcbe48630a704a106

subject: Extra safety on account-level DELETE
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 09:45:11.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/account.py'], 'message': 'Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: Ib5df11193b04eff69d14185bd9d0607169131e7f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: Ib5df11193b04eff69d14185bd9d0607169131e7f

commit_message:
Allows VMs to start up properly after host reboot

When a host starts up, it'll check if instances were running before the reboot,
by looking in the DB. If the instance was, it'll power that instance up.

 + Re-adds the 'start_guests_on_host_boot' config option
 + Makes it respect the DB status
 + Updates the nova.conf sample

Flags: DocImpact
Fixes bug 1169769

Change-Id: I9a8ae76757c32213612e132c223f1466234f1247

commit_message:
Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: I1693109cb5383f9611736fdd479ece48ece04f13

commit_message:
Add no_wait to synchronized

Enable the call to have a no_wait option with
lockutils synchronized. This will raise an exception
(ResourceUnavailable) if the resource is currently used.

The no_wait option only applies to external locks.

commit_message:
Adding iSCSI backend store driver

Allow Glance expose any iSCSI backend volume (LUN) as an image
(such as Cinder volume). Client can retrieve it through single or
multiple path. And according to this, nova-compute can use the iSCSI
(through single or multiple iSCSI path) plus dm-snapshot method to
implement base image and its COW mechanism, this will decrease base
image creating time and effective improve provisioning performance.

Implement bp:iscsi-backend-store

Change-Id: I7e0c914d96a2fb385f091b7a5cf9b580256113c8
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

caller.  This addresses policy exceptions in confirmResize,

PolicyNotAuthorized exceptions from bubbling up and returning 403 to the
caller.  This addresses policy exceptions in confirmResize,
revertResize, and reboot.

The try block calls into the compute api which sends a cast to perform
to bulk of the work, so there is little chance of an exception bubbling
up which is not already being caught.

Removes a unit test for a condition that should not exist.

Bug 1170453

Change-Id: I516a19894ab3d183057c774e84c4faa7053a6463
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Don't swallow PolicyNotAuthorized for resize/reboot actions

Removes 'except Exception' lines in the api which were preventing
PolicyNotAuthorized exceptions from bubbling up and returning 403 to the
caller.  This addresses policy exceptions in confirmResize,
revertResize, and reboot.

The try block calls into the compute api which sends a cast to perform
to bulk of the work, so there is little chance of an exception bubbling
up which is not already being caught.

Removes a unit test for a condition that should not exist.

Bug 1170453

Change-Id: I516a19894ab3d183057c774e84c4faa7053a6463

subject: Drop cache after fsync
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 18:40:01.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py'], 'message': 'Drop cache after fsync

Drop the cache (fadvise) after calling fsync to avoid redundant work
in the kernel visiting pages that are dirty. By dropping cache after
fsync(), the pages will be clean so can be easily removed from the
cache.

Change-Id: I3013d2ac1e27bbe43e58a81638d04805f5e2ae6e
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Drop cache after fsync

Drop the cache (fadvise) after calling fsync to avoid redundant work
in the kernel visiting pages that are dirty. By dropping cache after
fsync(), the pages will be clean so can be easily removed from the
cache.

Change-Id: I3013d2ac1e27bbe43e58a81638d04805f5e2ae6e
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add parsing to extra-specs key check

When using the filter scheduler which is now the default,
we can no longer pass in extra-specs like: {minIOPS:500, ....},
because the capabilities filter will reject this because there is
no host reporting minIOPS:500 capabilities.

We now need to scope the keys (ie qos:minIOPS:500....), but
that unfortunately requires a fix to the SolidFire driver.

This change add a check for the ':' in the key, and parses
on it if it's there.

Also fixes backend_name and uses VERSION var instead of
generating string in stats reporting.

Fixes bug: 1167141

Change-Id: Ie7fd7d231af78cb18a13f44a4379b44d3c3385df

commit_message:
set bdm['volume_id'] to None

The bdm got from sqlalchemy is an object not a dict,
but in the unitest bdm is dict,
so just set bdm['volume_id'] to None rather than delete it

Fix bug 1166160

Change-Id: I880c18526de4df31ad6749afdcb803c57874a41d

commit_message:
Add x-remove-versions-location for feature: disable versioning

We can set x-versions-location empty to remove this header in API, but
to keep consistent, we should allow x-remove-versions-location too. The
usage is post "x-remove-versions-locaion: x", just like ACL remove
headers.

Fixed: bug #1107592

Change-Id: I1271eec6401d4a0e8c1a7c2d63aeb8dfef00bf6d

commit_message:
Fix bug in os-availability-zone extension.

Fixes bug 1167956.
The call to get the list of availability zones (GET V2/os-availability-zone)
doesn't hide internal availability zone if all services in that zone are
disabled.

Change-Id: I2c49ad68c2ee5ddea0536dfa770f649fbb392b63

subject: Fix _error_out_instance exception handler
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 13:41:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix _error_out_instance exception handler

Since Eventlet clears exceptions between greenthread switching, we need
to save that exception so it can be re-raised.

The _error_out_instance event handler did not wrap the quotas call with
the save_and_reraise_exception, so the original exception was lost.

Fixes bug 1163552

Change-Id: I69d28917aae1d787351cd800f8996532e5485eb2
(cherry picked from commit 25afdbbda8d56c509a4b34e0d6feeaafb2e46e5b)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix _error_out_instance exception handler

Since Eventlet clears exceptions between greenthread switching, we need
to save that exception so it can be re-raised.

The _error_out_instance event handler did not wrap the quotas call with
the save_and_reraise_exception, so the original exception was lost.

Fixes bug 1163552

Change-Id: I69d28917aae1d787351cd800f8996532e5485eb2
(cherry picked from commit 25afdbbda8d56c509a4b34e0d6feeaafb2e46e5b)

commit_message:
nova coverage create lots empty folders

with nova coverage extenstion disabled as a default behavior,
we noticed that a lot of empty folders is created under /tmp
folder. And also with each time the nova service reboot, it
will create new directory with name like nova_coverage_*.
WIth time go by, there will be nubmer of the empty folders
accumulated.

Fixes: bug 1169005

Change-Id: I85975b79f4da012c6fb0c37310d3390d3c692be0

commit_message:
Fixed unicode username user creation error

The code tries to construct a byte string object to test the
length of the string field (The explicit construction of the
string object is neccessary as sometime v can be other types,
for example int). This will cause error if the string field
(v) is a unicode object.

Fixes bug #1166701

Change-Id: I73cee4da5c9f91ce135e7f81d88c979871f61767

This patch introduces the new API extension to support the new
format of block devices proposed as part of the
improve-block-device-handling blueprint.

This patch proposes how this can be done in the backwards compatible
way so that both old and new cli syntax and API data model will work,
however tuhe old syntax of --block_device_mapping attribute to boot
should be deprecated at some point

Futrher to that, the patch migrates the database to the new structure,
and introduces the validations of block device mappings in the API layer.
At the moment none of the new information is used in the virt layer,
as this will be addressed by subsequent patches.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling
blueprint: flexible-block-device-config

Change-Id: I76989a6a819405539733c0f354764129eeaeb5fe
', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-03-22 17:50:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Block Device Mapping refactoring - DB & API layer

This patch is the first part of refactoring of how nova internally
handles block device mappings for instance.

This patch introducese the following high level changes:

* Migrates the database and adds new columns to the BlockDeviceMapping
table
* Introduces the API extension to handle the new data format that can be
passed to Nova and still be able to handle the old data model, and API
* Introduces more solid block device validation in the API layer.
* Refactors tests to be aware of the new data structure
* Introduces some common routines for dealing with block device mappings

The substantial size of the patch is due to the fact that block devices
are used heavily throughout Nova and changing the data layout resulting
in the need to tweak a lot of differents parts of the codebase. Going
forward there will be more work put into unifying the programming
interface through which nova code will deal with block devices so that
future changes can be less invasive.

More details on the new data model and the future interfaces are layed
out in the following wiki page:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/BlockDeviceConfig

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I76989a6a819405539733c0f354764129eeaeb5fe

commit_message:
Block Device Mapping refactoring - DB & API layer

This patch is the first part of refactoring of how nova internally
handles block device mappings for instance.

This patch introducese the following high level changes:

* Migrates the database and adds new columns to the BlockDeviceMapping
table
* Introduces the API extension to handle the new data format that can be
passed to Nova and still be able to handle the old data model, and API
* Introduces more solid block device validation in the API layer.
* Refactors tests to be aware of the new data structure
* Introduces some common routines for dealing with block device mappings

The substantial size of the patch is due to the fact that block devices
are used heavily throughout Nova and changing the data layout resulting
in the need to tweak a lot of differents parts of the codebase. Going
forward there will be more work put into unifying the programming
interface through which nova code will deal with block devices so that
future changes can be less invasive.

More details on the new data model and the future interfaces are layed
out in the following wiki page:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/BlockDeviceConfig

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I76989a6a819405539733c0f354764129eeaeb5fe

subject: Add capabilities reporting to ThinLVM driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 22:40:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add capabilities reporting to ThinLVM driver

ThinLVM driver was missing the newly required capabilities reporting
and inheritance from the parent LVM driver doesn't work because the
capacity reporting methods between regular LVM and Thin LVM are not
compatable.

This patch add the basic requirements needed in the capabilities reporting
to make it usable by the filter scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1166572

Change-Id: I471dcc31d07516e71bcd2d3ae03e0405e0594697

ThinLVM driver was missing the newly required capabilities reporting
and inheritance from the parent LVM driver doesn't work because the
capacity reporting methods between regular LVM and Thin LVM are not
compatible.

This patch add the basic requirements needed in the capabilities reporting
to make it usable by the filter scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1166572

Change-Id: I471dcc31d07516e71bcd2d3ae03e0405e0594697
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add capabilities reporting to ThinLVM driver

ThinLVM driver was missing the newly required capabilities reporting
and inheritance from the parent LVM driver doesn't work because the
capacity reporting methods between regular LVM and Thin LVM are not
compatible.

This patch add the basic requirements needed in the capabilities reporting
to make it usable by the filter scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1166572

Change-Id: I471dcc31d07516e71bcd2d3ae03e0405e0594697

commit_message:
Improve Fedora build host support: PATH.

Fedora (and potentially other) build hosts will not automatically
have /usr/local/bin in their $PATH. We now detect its absence and
add it back.

Based on a patch from Lucas Alvares Gomes

Change-Id: Icbf1db7c5515d9274b4cd18c52ad8dafdc835718

Implements blueprint bp/openvz-driver

This is my first attempt at wrapping up openvz that makes sense and gives
a greater level of control of OpenVz containers from Nova.  The driver is
known to work on debian based distros with flat networking using multiple
network interfaces.  There is some code for supporting redhat based distros
but will need to have some templates made.

In testing I haven't found any race conditions however we will be deploying
an earlier version of this driver in a beta service at some point so the
feedback from its heavier usage may lead to more improvements.

Change-Id: I2a1c41c50adac0d04ee418c6b572f6041462a321
', 'number': 12}]
commit_message:
Adds openvz support to nova.

Implements blueprint openvz-driver

This is my first attempt at wrapping up openvz that makes sense and gives
a greater level of control of OpenVz containers from Nova.  The driver is
known to work on debian based distros with flat networking using multiple
network interfaces.  There is some code for supporting redhat based distros
but will need to have some templates made.

Change-Id: I2a1c41c50adac0d04ee418c6b572f6041462a321

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix failing NetApp tests

The tests were failing due to an upgrade in the testing framework
(possibly due to upgrade of nose package from 1.2.1 to 1.3.0).
The actual reason was a bug in the suds client. A simple
workaround is utilised here, which sets the logging level of a
suds file to INFO instead of DEBUG.

Some 'FutureWarning' warnings from the test output were also
fixed.

Change-Id: Ia67476c23bffa91264cf79f6a26944b450c4f4fc

commit_message:
Use a SSH pool to manage SSH connection

Use a SSH pool to hold all SSH clients.It allows 4 SSH clients
at most to connect to the SSH server at the same time.
This patchset also enables every SSH client connect to the other
controller when they failed to connect to the current controller.
For example,failed to A,then to B,or,failed to B,then to A.

Fixes bug: 1162251
Change-Id: I86f7f684639034be97ddf2031e61ac6bf3a196ad

commit_message:
xenapi: Make _connect_volume exc handler eventlet safe

`forget_sr` blocks and so clears the exception state causing the
subsequent raise to try to raise `None`, which fails.

Fixes bug 1167515

Change-Id: I18562c7389b152a6490d352c5a8d36934288f47d

commit_message:
Allow all headers requested for CORS.

- We allow all headers requested in preflight request. The CORS
  specification does leave the door open for this, as mentioned in
  http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/#resource-preflight-requests
  Note: Since the list of headers can be unbounded
  simply returning headers can be enough.
- This is a followup to review:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24415/.
- Fixes bug 1155034.

Change-Id: If7b8f2f3a581c5209892d1ccc9f06ddb8fac92dd

commit_message:
Support turning Sphinx warnings into errors.

The build team would like to be able to turn this on for projects.
Also, we should make it configurable. And while we're making that
configurable, we should also make autoindexing configurable.

Change-Id: I763329372be91afe442e87c7f3c0934763b4afc0

commit_message:
require sections are specified in nova_config

This massive code commit actually implements something very simple.

previously, we allowed nova_config to omit a section and assumed that
section was default.

This commit updates the code to require section names for all settings.

This change is being made b/c:
- it better maps to the config on disk
- it is consistent with the other modules

Change-Id: Iae71a4c48ed0f9792566f16f0bf13e61569b46e5

commit_message:
Drop Swift requirement on keystone:python.

I believe this requirement was added to obtain support auth_token
middleware (keystone auth support). This is now provided via
keystoneclient.

Since this requirement no longer works we should drop it since
it is heavyweight to install keystone source code on all the
swift proxies.

Most packages automatically require keystoneclient as well so
we can probably ignore automatically adding this dep in here. I'm open
to doing that if we thing it worthwhile... but we'll first need to
make a keystone::client module to support it.

Change-Id: I2a85ea964d2b9e1a93c3ec0ba8de31b188c140ea

commit_message:
Set config_file_path in storage::node.

This change makes it so that storage::node sets config_file_path
for each of the services correctly. Previously this would cause
swift config file fragments to get written to
/etc/swift/<service>/600?.conf instead of /etc/swift/<service>.conf.

Fixes config issues for me on Fedora when using swift::storage::node.

Change-Id: I8d0ce87a545af805e24c5594b437483f9b479c9d

subject: Refactored lists of nodes to contact for requests
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-06 01:54:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Refactored lists of nodes to contact for requests

Extensive refactor here to consolidate what nodes are contacted for
any request. This consolidation means reads will contact the same set
of nodes that writes would, giving a very good chance that
read-your-write behavior will succeed. This also means that writes
will not necessarily try all nodes in the cluster as it would
previously, which really wasn't desirable anyway. (If you really want
that, you can set request_node_count to a really big number, but
understand that also means reads will contact every node looking for
something that might not exist.)

* Added a request_node_count proxy-server conf value that allows
  control of how many nodes are contacted for a normal request.

In proxy.controllers.base.Controller:

* Got rid of error_increment since it was only used in one spot by
  another method and just served to confuse.

* Made error_occurred also log the device name.

* Made error_limit require an error message and also documented a bit
  better.

* Changed iter_nodes to just take a ring and a partition and yield
  all the nodes itself so it could control the number of nodes used
  in a given request. Also happens to consolidate where sort_nodes is
  called.

* Updated account_info and container_info to use all nodes from
  iter_nodes and to call error_occurred appropriately.

* Updated GETorHEAD_base to not track attempts on its own and just
  stop when iter_nodes tells it to stop. Also, it doesn't take the
  nodes to contact anymore; instead it takes the ring and gets the
  nodes from iter_nodes itself.

Elsewhere:

* Made changes to reflect the above.

Change-Id: I37f76c99286b6456311abf25167cd0485bfcafac

commit_message:
Refactored lists of nodes to contact for requests

Extensive refactor here to consolidate what nodes are contacted for
any request. This consolidation means reads will contact the same set
of nodes that writes would, giving a very good chance that
read-your-write behavior will succeed. This also means that writes
will not necessarily try all nodes in the cluster as it would
previously, which really wasn't desirable anyway. (If you really want
that, you can set request_node_count to a really big number, but
understand that also means reads will contact every node looking for
something that might not exist.)

* Added a request_node_count proxy-server conf value that allows
  control of how many nodes are contacted for a normal request.

In proxy.controllers.base.Controller:

* Got rid of error_increment since it was only used in one spot by
  another method and just served to confuse.

* Made error_occurred also log the device name.

* Made error_limit require an error message and also documented a bit
  better.

* Changed iter_nodes to just take a ring and a partition and yield
  all the nodes itself so it could control the number of nodes used
  in a given request. Also happens to consolidate where sort_nodes is
  called.

* Updated account_info and container_info to use all nodes from
  iter_nodes and to call error_occurred appropriately.

* Updated GETorHEAD_base to not track attempts on its own and just
  stop when iter_nodes tells it to stop. Also, it doesn't take the
  nodes to contact anymore; instead it takes the ring and gets the
  nodes from iter_nodes itself.

Elsewhere:

* Ring now has a get_part method.

* Made changes to reflect all of the above.

Change-Id: I37f76c99286b6456311abf25167cd0485bfcafac

subject: Incorrect logging setup - duplicating root handlers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-09 14:01:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': 'Incorrect logging setup - duplicating root handlers

Stop adding the log handlers from the root logger to the logger specified via
the default_log_levels configuration setting. If the handler should dispatch
a event then it will do it once for the specified logger and once for root
logger thus duplicating the event.

Change-Id: I1a7880322ff53cbdf8048e1d805511ca76929ee3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Incorrect logging setup - duplicating root handlers

Stop adding the log handlers from the root logger to the logger specified via
the default_log_levels configuration setting. If the handler should dispatch
a event then it will do it once for the specified logger and once for root
logger thus duplicating the event.

Change-Id: I1a7880322ff53cbdf8048e1d805511ca76929ee3

Re-add setuptools-git to setup.py

In 02f59a0768a56c084fa72ac9c1e47f1a819baadc we removed:

  setup_requires=['setuptools-git>=0.4'],

from setup.py file and it broke tarball generation in that some files

If mount_check is true (ie an SAIO with "real "devices, not loopback),
then the servers will correctly return 507 when given a nonsense path.
The first element is treated as a drive path, and that path isn't
mounted. This patch adds 507 as a valid status response to the server
check.

Change-Id: I1d1bb0ab78fd9ea17323635da7e686182fbdbf13
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fix probe tests to work in a VM using mount_check

If mount_check is true (ie an SAIO with "real "devices, not loopback),
then the servers will correctly return 507 when given a nonsense path.
The first element is treated as a drive path, and that path isn't
mounted. This patch adds 507 as a valid status response to the server
check.

Change-Id: I1d1bb0ab78fd9ea17323635da7e686182fbdbf13

commit_message:
link /etc/tgt/stack.d to cinder volumes directory

This creates /etc/tgt/stack.d as a symlink to the cinder volumes
directory and includes it in /etc/tgt/targets.conf in a similar way
to /etc/tgt/conf.d

targets.conf only gets appended to when the symlink is created.
Any old /etc/tgt/conf.d/stack.conf is deleted

Change-Id: Ifb6412f6860ceb28b724644fb9b618638f552102
Fixes: bug #1072121

commit_message:
Add logging configuration

The tempest log can help developers analyze tests but
there is no option in run_tests.sh to enable logging output now.
This adds a logging configuration file and options in run_test.sh
and enables developers to get the tempest log more easily.

Implements: blueprint add-logging-configuration
Change-Id: Iee68a34f5771f1bff88110d95538a5b43103ced9

subject: Add NOVA_LOCALEDIR env variable
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-01 15:37:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add NOVA_LOCALEDIR env variable

Part of fixing bug #995287

Syncs these two commits from oslo-incubator:

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

to get a new gettextutils.install() function which allows the default
localedir to be overwritten via an environment variable.

Note that gettextutils.install() must be called before any other nova
modules are imported since some modules attempt to translate strings
at import time (e.g. the 'message' attributes on classes in
nova.exception). This is broken and inefficient, but fixing it involves
adding something like spinx's l_() function and would be very invaisve.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775

commit_message:
Add NOVA_LOCALEDIR env variable

Part of fixing bug #995287

Syncs these two commits from oslo-incubator:

  Support overriding oslo localedir too
  Add a gettextutils.install() helper function

to get a new gettextutils.install() function which allows the default
localedir to be overwritten via an environment variable.

Note that gettextutils.install() must be called before any other nova
modules are imported since some modules attempt to translate strings
at import time (e.g. the 'message' attributes on classes in
nova.exception). This is broken and inefficient, but fixing it involves
adding something like spinx's l_() function and would be very invaisve.

Also, note that calling gettextutils.install() in nova.cmd.__init__
means that no program which uses a different translation domain should
ever import any of the modules under nova.cmd.

Change-Id: I86562b3a65d371673bb21f7179eecc7602bc0775

commit_message:
Fix some of the pyflakes warnings.

A couple of them are too much work for now, but this at least gets
a bunch of things where we're shadowing other variables, or even
referring to variables that don't exist.

Change-Id: Iefb72903220a15971a065de87c8fddb9a9f55553

commit_message:
Add filter support for keypairs

EC2 DescribeKeys has support for filtering keys by name
and by fingerprint. Using euca-describe-keypairs with
compute returns all of the names or fingerprints of a
given filter result.

Add filter to filter out results. LP: #1160850

Change-Id: I2531d719b8c032a0ca7f6d949c69078c88e0d346
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
